title: Sango (1966) Genesis Portion
description: Sango (also spelled Sangho) is the primary language spoken in the Central African Republic and also the official language of the country. It is used as a lingua franca across the country and had 450,000 native speakers in 1988. It also has 1.6 million second-language speakers.

language.name: Sango
language.area: Widespread. Also in Chad, Congo, Democratic Republic of the Congo.
